DOC.brief_summary: The aim of this study is to compare clinical and laboratory findings of three surgical techniques in metabolic surgery in patients with type II diabetes mellitus and obesity (BMI> 30).
DOC.brief_title: Surgical Techniques in Diabetes Mellitus-II and Obesity. Metabolic Surgery Study (MSS)
DOC.criteria: BMI 3040 Diabetes Mellitus type II less than 10 years of evolution. AntiGAD, antipancreatic islets negative antibodies. C peptide normally between 0.9 and 4. Glycosylated hemoglobin greater than 6.5%. Less than 5 years of use insulin. Cirrosis hep√°tica. coagulopathies. Type 1 diabetes. HIV positive. Stomach or small intestine previous surgeries . Diseases of the exocrine pancreas: pancreatitis, pancreatectomy, neoplasia, cystic fibrosis, hemochromatosis. Endocrinopathies: acromegaly, glucagonoma, Cushing's syndrome, pheochromocytoma, hyperthyroidism, somatostatinoma, aldosteronoma. Genetic syndromes with diabetes.
